headline.seo: Paying Workers to Live Healthier Lives

docs.lead_paragraph: A fledgling industry is offering financial incentives for workers to adopt healthier habits in diet and exercise.
docs.snippet: A fledgling industry is offering financial incentives for workers to adopt healthier habits in diet and exercise.

docs.abstract: Technology can convert social support, encouragement and friendly prodding into better health.
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1900, an American man could expect to live on average until he was 45 years old. By 1940, that life-expectancy number had jumped to 62 years, while for women the average number increased from 51 years to 66 years.
docs.snippet: Technology can convert social support, encouragement and friendly prodding into better health.

headline.seo: A Budget for New York’s Future
headline.print_headline: A Budget for New York’s Future
headline.main: A Budget for New York’s Future

docs.lead_paragraph: With a deficit estimated at $9 billion, New York needs a fair, no-frills budget that tackles the fiscal realities.
docs.snippet: With a deficit estimated at $9 billion, New York needs a fair, no-frills budget that tackles the fiscal realities.

headline.seo: How Doctors Would Cut Health Care Costs
headline.print_headline: Doctors Offer Thoughts on Cutting Health Care Costs
headline.main: Doctors Offer Thoughts on Cutting Health Care Costs

docs.lead_paragraph: Is it possible to contain medical costs without compromising quality? Some physicians have a few suggestions.
docs.snippet: Is it possible to contain medical costs without compromising quality? Some physicians have a few suggestions.

headline.main: Bill on School Lunch Is Scaled Back. Criticism of School Lunch Isn't.

docs.abstract: A Senate bill on school lunch financing advances with much less money than President Obama sought.
docs.lead_paragraph: It's been an unusually tough month for the people who make school lunches.
docs.snippet: A Senate bill on school lunch financing advances with much less money than President Obama sought.

headline.main: Santa Clara County to Consider Restricting Toys With Fast Food

docs.abstract: A Santa Clara County Supervisor proposed restricting the ability of fast-food restaurants to use toys to sell children high-calorie food with low nutritional value.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ken Yeager, the president of the Santa Clara County Board of Supervisors, has been on Fox, CNN and MSNBC in recent days because of a proposal he has floated that the county restrict fast-food restaurants' tendency to use toys to reward children for making unhealthy food choices.
docs.snippet: A Santa Clara County Supervisor proposed restricting the ability of fast-food restaurants to use toys to sell children high-calorie food with low nutritional value.

docs.abstract: Doctors offer their solutions for cutting rising health care costs in today's Patient Money column.
docs.lead_paragraph: Today's Patient Money column considers the pressing problem of rising health care costs, an issue brought to the fore by the past year's health care reform debate. How can the country reduce medical costs while not compromising quality?
docs.snippet: Doctors offer their solutions for cutting rising health care costs in today's Patient Money column.

headline.print_headline: China Now Leads World in Diabetes Cases
headline.main: China Now Leads World in Diabetes Cases

docs.lead_paragraph: One in 10 Chinese adults already have the disease and an additional 16 percent are on the verge of developing it, according to a new study.
docs.snippet: One in 10 Chinese adults already have the disease and an additional 16 percent are on the verge of developing it, according to a new study.

headline.main: Better Ways to Help the Public Lose Weight

docs.abstract: How can anti-obesity campaigns promote health without discriminating against overweight people?
docs.lead_paragraph: It seems like everywhere we turn -- whether it's bans on school bake sales, required calorie counts in fast food chains, or First Lady Michelle Obama toiling in her White House garden -- we are being told to watch our weight. There's even the national Campaign to End Obesity, which is "dedicated to reversing America's costliest medical condition" and advocates for "federal policies that promote healthy weight."
docs.snippet: How can anti-obesity campaigns promote health without discriminating against overweight people?
